Author: lsh99

Comment: It's also that Canada has tougher regulation on ag/food, including on animal health. The bird flu has been an open concern for several seasons (couple years ago they were quarantining zoo animals indoors during goose migrating season, even) but that also means measures have been taken to reduce the risk.    It's not that Canada is immune, but it's likely the same reason that Canada had a fraction of the excess death rate (I'm not talking absolute numbers) that the US did during Covid.    Canada has more trust in institutions, and especially now, those institutions work better. That helps in any medical crisis, human or animal.
Author: JustAskingTA
